definition: to transfer/to maneuver (troops etc)/movement of personnel/to mobilize/to bring into play
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Engage your core muscles, then curl your upper body towards a sitting position.
sentences.chinese: 調動人體核心部位的肌肉力量向上擡體，成坐姿。

sentences.english: To get that figure, look at the figures before seasonal adjustment.
sentences.chinese: 爲了得到這個數字，我們先來看下季節調動的情況。

sentences.english: They emphasize test-first development, heavy customer involvement, and refactoring.
sentences.chinese: 它們強調開發中測試第一，積極調動客戶和重構。

sentences.english: The captain applied to headquarters for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 上尉向司令部請求調動。

sentences.english: At present, we must transfer all active factors to resolve the problem of employment.
sentences.chinese: 當前我們應調動一切積極因素，打好就業攻堅戰。

sentences.english: It is under the absolute leadership of the Central Military Commission.
sentences.chinese: 中央軍委有關軍隊的調動指揮是通過總參來執行的。

sentences.english: The little man got everyone all worked up.
sentences.chinese: 這個小個子男人調動了每個人的情緒。

sentences.english: At the same time, Japan speeded up sending troops to Northeast China, then the Russo-Japanese War began.
sentences.chinese: 同時，日本加快向中國東北調動部隊，日俄戰爭爆發。

sentences.english: As a Colonel, he was transferred to the high profile Death Star assignment.
sentences.chinese: 作爲上校，他被調動到高層的死星赴任。

sentences.english: I think I've jumped out of the frying-pan into the fire by changing jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我調動工作真是跳出釜底進火坑。

sentences.english: You have to be able to listen well if you are going to motivate the people who work for you .
sentences.chinese: 你要善於聽取意見才能調動你手下工作人員的積極性。

sentences.english: III. Introduce the competition mechanism and fully motivate the employees' initiative for work.
sentences.chinese: 引入競爭機制，充分調動員工的工作積極性。

sentences.english: The movement of troops augurs ill for the peace of the area.
sentences.chinese: 部隊的調動對這地區的和平是一種凶兆。

sentences.english: To bring your opponent to the net.
sentences.chinese: 爲了調動你的對手來到網前。

sentences.english: How should we motivate general publics in disaster-affected area to participate in reconstruction?
sentences.chinese: 如何調動基層人民參與災後重建的積極性。

sentences.english: Employees moniter video screens and dispatch agents where they are needed.
sentences.chinese: 工作人員監視視頻屏幕並且調動人員到需要的地方去。

definition: to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
aspect/facet/level (political, psychological, spiritual etc)/(geology) bedding plane
to coordinate/to harmonize/to fit together/to match (colors etc)/harmonious/concerted
to utilize/to put sth to use
to adjust/to regulate/to harmonize/to reconcile (accountancy etc)
